definition: (idiom) fully displaying one's capabilities
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
to make visible/to reveal/prominent/conspicuous/(prefix) phanero-
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: Try to make at least three people smile a day.
sentences.chinese: 请大显身手，每天至少引领三个人开心张笑口。

sentences.english: This is where the registry steps in.
sentences.chinese: 这正是注册中心大显身手的地方。

sentences.english: Color psychologists also work in the decorating field.
sentences.chinese: 同样，色彩心理学家也在家装领域大显身手。

sentences.english: Therefore all of staff in our company revelries together on afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 下午，公司全体员工狂欢，化妆师们大显身手。

sentences.english: The wind came out to play one day.
Which is where the New New face comes in.
sentences.chinese: 这就是新新脸蛋大显身手的地方。

sentences.english: It's time to blow the big one, am I right?
sentences.chinese: 该是大显身手的时候了，你说我说的对吗？

sentences.english: Now they're back, and ready to reassert themselves.
sentences.chinese: 现在它们卷土重来，准备要大显身手。

definition: to showcase one's (unique) talents/to display one's (individual) prowess
to display one's remarkable skill or prowess/to give full play to one's brilliant abilities
to accomplish much/to have good prospects/to have a promising future
ample scope for abilities/favorable position for the use of one's skills (idiom)
to put to good use/to come in handy
fig. to rub one's fists and wipe one's palms (idiom)/to roll up one's sleeves for battle/eager to get into action or start on a task
lit. like a tiger that has grown wings/with redoubled power (idiom)
first sign of budding talent/to display one's ability for the first time
to shine (of talents, skills, accomplishment)/to demonstrate extraordinary talent or skill
with great prospects for the future (idiom); well worth doing
see 小試牛刀|小试牛刀[xiao3 shi4 niu2 dao1]
lit. to sharpen one's sword (idiom)/fig. to prepare to attack/to be getting ready for battle
lit. to first show one's horns (idiom); fig. a first show of emerging talent/first sign of emerging talent/budding genius
to give a small demonstration of one's impressive skills (idiom)
to achieve or accomplish goals
to be eager to give sth a try (idiom)
